descriptionMarkdown:
Clock-'wise' multisignal memory cell. 

​
**Pros:** 
* Can work with any sign of signal 
* With any type of signal: pulse or constant
* Any number of signals 
* No signals in an output were reserved for set/reset
* set/reset signal is automatically generating by clock-'wise' system
* simultaneously usage of red and green signals, at the output they will be merged(to use both wires, repeat the connection between 2 bottom combinators)
​

**Cons:**
* using 11 combinators instead of only 3
* have issues with high-speed updates
​
What is clock-'wise': system that can set the period of update via ITE signals: 
* I is step
* T is theshold(max duration of update cycle) 
* E is execution point(where exactly from 1 to T update will happen)
​
For example: 
1. I:1, T:15, E:30 - every 0.5 second, update will happen at 15th tick
2. I:1, T:2, E:1 - every tick
3. I:1, T:50, E:60 - every second, update will happen at 5/6 of second
​
If you want max update rate, use example 2, otherwise all you have to change is T, and set E as T/2. For 1 tick update rate, the difference between the real and stored signal would be up to 6 if it was counted from the source.

Fell free to do other combinations of these signals if you need to, with one rule: E < T, otherwise update point will never be reached.

Scheme was teseted:
* Zero values still correctly updates
* Wrong values of ITE will not break memory content
* Internal signal N as well as ITE are not affecting output
* S signal cannot be input
* S signal not included in the output
* at a random point in time when E=I simultaneously happens with source signal removal, memory can be erased. The lower the T, the higher the chances to this to happen. For now this is the main flow and I don't know how to get rid of this(or too lazy)

There is an example that you can play with: [*link*](https://factorioprints.com/view/-Nl8yzNEPDBoluxKtgBD)

This was based on AlexAegis' multi-signal memory cell: [*link*](https://www.factorio.school/view/-LXNpyTm9_3pVRdhNcCk)

[*More detailed explanation of parts of this scheme*](https://imgur.com/gallery/O7s7saL)
title: Clock-'wise' multisignal memory cell V2.0
